ratings.comment: Dr. Jay was a staple at UW Madison for 35 years who retired in Dec. 2015. Through 3 courses with him (MSE 350, ME 314, ME 342) you quickly realize he is here to teach, and probably teaches the most students per year than any other faculty member.  He hand grades all the tests individually and really enjoys his students. Sad to see him go.

This was  a great class. Dr. Jay has been there a long time. I am glad I got to take a class with him and he helped me even though I didn't do to hot on an exam. Can be dry and boring discussion for some. I sit up front and nothing too bad.
Dr. Jay is a great professor who has been here a long time. He really knows his stuff. He was always willing to work with students and also has the longest office hours I have ever seen.
Boring and useless. Such a cool course, such a shame that he's teaching it. Read the book, find people to study with, no need to go to lecture ever.

Love this guy. Horribly dry and boring lecture but he loves when you come to office hours and hang out with him. He is a little condescending if you ask questions in lectures. Knows his stuff though. One of my favorite professors at UW.
Really bad

Horribly dry and hard to listen to. Not helpful at all because he doesn't show up to office hours. Don't sit in the back because you won't be able to hear his mumbling over his ancient projector's fan. That being said, read/skim the "textbook" and know the labs and the exam is easy.

I don't know where the hate is coming from. He is a really smart guy who has served his time since the 80's. His class is boring but it's not that hard and he's awesome. If you go into office hours he's just happy that you're there to hang out with him. Do the practice exams and the assignments and you'll be fine.3

i'll give you the warning about how there is only 1 exam for his class and mine was bull. read the book and get ready for dumb questions. example- in this 15th century picture of a bell foundry who's the apprentice in the picture. That has nothing to do with the class. he barely goes over welding in the exam which is half the class
Select his class!!! Please!!!!Really nice teacher!!!!!@!!!!!!!
Poor professor, not helpful at all. He gets mad if you send him emails. I once asked him a question, he sighed and went, hopeless. Exams are fine if you study the previous exams though.

One of the worst profs I've ever had. Completely uninterested and uninteresting. Lectures are useless. Homework is what correlates to tests, but you're left to your own devices to figure that out from scratch. Awful prof, awful class.

Does a terrible job presenting information.  You will learn everything you need to know from discussion.  Lectures will put you to sleep.  However he the curve is extremely forgiving.  It would be hard to get less than a B in this class.

Dr. Jay wrote a fantastic textbook in the early nineties. His classes are really off topic and you learn a lot about kitchen pots and knives and random old vases and material samples he owns. If you want to get an A, skip class and read through his textbook. Do the homework(even though i'm sure you'll find the answers), they're basically the exams

Love this guy. Honestly not sure if he's depressed or mildly autistic because of his communication skills. Lectures were a bit odd because he likes to talk about things that might be interesting but you really don't need to know. Do your homework, don't cheat it and you'll probably get higher than a B.
Jay is a straight up G. Love the guy, take him before he retires. You will not regret it. One of the coolest profs I've ever had
Good guy who means well, lecture is somewhat boring but he knows what he's talking about and the exams are just like the homework so I don't understand why people complain about his teaching.

Hard to stay awake in class, but he is definitely very knowledgeable on the subject. He uses the same book every year so its easy to get homework answers and if you go to class and study his book its not that difficult. Tests are EXACTLY like the homework and practice tests. Not a tough class

Dr. Jay is an awesome guy. If you go into his office hours he is actually very nice and just wants students to talk with sometimes. Ask him and he will help you with any problem you have on his homework. Easy A if you read the course manual before the tests!

Terrible, he uses the same old textbook he made before I was born and just rambles in class. basically you memorize the practice tests the night before and get by. Didnt learn a single thing but got by with a "B".

Dr. Jay is a bad professor. His lectures consist of filling in blanks in a textbook he made a long time ago. He doesn't use email.  Homework isn't very relevant to lecture.  People say his class is easy only because exams are similar to practice exams. He never explains anything. I'm avoiding him for ME 306.

Dr. Samuel is the worst lecturer I've had so far. The best way to stay awake in his class is to read the Herald. That being said, his tests are relatively straightforward and are exactly like the homework and practice exams. Understand how do do them and you will understand the exams. The class isn't bad. The professor is.

Everything you need is in the course manual. You really don't need Dr. Jay to succeed in this class. Exams are just like practice exams in course manual. Lectures were more entertainment than anything. If taught correctly, I probably could've gotten more out of the class, but either way, it was nice to have a light class.

Awesome dude as far as I can tell, never went to class but tests were very straight forward and just like the homework/practice tests. Any problems people have with this class are unwarranted, it's extremely straight forward.

Really boring lecturer. Comes off very condescending, especially if you go to office hours. The homework is rarely related to what he's teaching. Get ready to be very good at googling things. The tests are exactly like the practice exams, though. Overall just not a good professor.

Class itself is super boring but with this subject there isn't much he can do about it. exams are exactly like the homework/ practice exams. if you really want to learn the subject without wasting time, go visit his office ours and have him teach you. you'll learn far more than going to class
Pretty boring and monotone, but material is easy enough if you take a little time and go through it.  Exams are exactly like the practice tests.

If you go to lecture and do the homework, you should get an A. It's laughably easy. That being said, he spend every lecture period solving problems and spends almost no time on theory. Some people may like that, but I came away from the class feeling like I didn't really understand any of the underlying concepts.

This guy basically runs the whole materials science program and has a TON of experience in the industry and in teaching. He wrote the whole course manual himself too. As long as you go to lecture, understand the practice exams and occasionally go to office hours, you will get an A. He can come off as rude and crabby but he's a really nice guy.

I really liked him. He is a friedly guy who knows what he is talking about and for the most part teaches it very clearly. He has like 12 office hours a week, so getting out of class help from him isn't really a problem. And midterms are basically exactly the same as his practice tests, just with different numbers, so pay attention and it'll be easy

If you pay attention in lecture and buy his exam guide you have no problem getting over a 90 on every test. His midterm in spring 2010 was literally straight out of the exam guide. Easy A for everyone.
He is straight forward and helpful if you visit his office hours. He is passionate about teaching and likes his students. My favorite professor at UW without a doubt.

Prof. Samuel is very condescending and talks down to all of his students.  He is not helpful if you are having problems.  Make sure you know the material on the practice exams and you'll do fine on the tests.

Pretty dull and boring, but straightforward. Go to lecture and pay attention, since you won't find any of the homework answers on the internet. All homework is online. The exams are exactly like the practice exams, so make sure you know how to do them. Not too bad of a class.
Dr. Jay is no spring chicken. He does not like internet engineers. So don't use google to find the answers for the problems. He also enjoys long walks along the beach.
Dr. J is awesome.  He could care less about teaching but the class is easy as can be.  What could be better

Exams are exactly like the practice exams, which is the only thing that allows you any chance of being prepared for them. Assignments are tedious, course pack is confusing, and by the end of the semester the only thing you'll remember is that he SOMEHOW won an award.

I don't understand how this professor keeps winning awards. I feel as though he has been one of my worst. Completely intimidating and unapproachable if you have a problem. Lectures are not very helpful.
The class is easy enough, but he is really unhelpful if you try to talk to him, and lecture is only marginally helpful in understanding.  On the bright side, I'm now well acquainted with wikipedia

Dr. Jay was not a very inspiring teacher.  He is pretty jaded and cynical which occasionally adds humor to the otherwise dull lectures.  Homework can be hard and time consuming, but most sections are straight forward.  Tests are exactly like practice exams.  The course packet includes all sorts of information that can help so look through it.

Good teacher.  His lectures consist of mainly examples, and not too much theory which i really appreciated.  If you attend lecture, you will do fine in the class.  The examples he does in class are just like the homework, and the exams he provides at Bob's Copy shop are very helpful.

Dr. Samuel was a pretty good teacher.  The only thing I would warn people about would be that he's usually not the most friendly the first few times you stop in for office hours.  He had office hours 3 hours a day, every day of the week, so he's usually available, just don't be discouraged if you don't like the way he explains things at first.

I didn't really get anything from lecture and copied most of the homework. The night before the exams i looked at all the homework and practice exam and got an A or B on each....If true or false question its almost always true

drinking with dr j is an awesome class.  the material is extremely interesting and useful for ME's going into manufacturing or materials science, and the tests, group projects, and homeworks are pretty straightforward.

This guy is awesome with the teaching of MoM. He claims if you use a solultions manuel 'you will get a bloody nose' and he is right! I never used one but rather bought his optional course packet at Bob's and had myself an enjoyable time for a semester.

Is very clear in lecture, though a bit dry. Still easy to learn from. His "poker" chip questions were fun, and encouraged class participation. Tests are fair to easy, and homework is a breeze especially if you have previous years or just go to his homework sessions. Highly recommended!

he does a good job at giving you materials about what's expected on the exams.  his homeworks are long and stupid - which sux if you are the 25% of the class that actually does them (the rest gets them from past years).He hasn't changed the material for 15 years.  Decent guy.  Maybe a tad out there but overall nice and he is helpful @ office hours.

I agree he is kind of cold and overrated, but compared to most other professors he is pretty good.. can be funny and tries to learn names.. great at explaining things so i recommend going to lecture.. his tests are pretty unique (for any class he teaches) so DEFINITELY look at practice exams - if you understand those, u will do well in the class

"Dr. Jay" is not as great as everyone says he is. He is a very cold person, makes you feel dumb when you go to office hours, and he doesn't like women. The class is all memorization, and it's a lot of (useless) material.  The homeworks line up with lecture mostly, but some of them are simply busy work. Should be at least an easy B.
Great guy, exams are extremly similar to class notes and practice exams, go to his office hours to get help on the hw assignments
Uses very similar tests each semester.

Monotonous and sarcastic, but funny. The class makes me tired and the homework occasionally has little to do with the lecture, but it isn't that bad. He is probably one of those guys that is too smart to hang around normal people, so his interpesronal skills are a little off, but he is nice. He also seems to have an obsession with monkeys.

Doctor Jay is awesome!  His class teaches you things that you will be able to apply for the rest of your life.  His lectures may get to you at times, but you'll appreciate going when the exact material shows up word for word on the homework and exams.
This class involves a lot of memorization.  The concepts are not very difficult or anything, it just ends up being a lot of material.  Jay seems to know his stuff pretty well.
No Comments

Cares about students and is a pretty funny guy, but sarcastic.  You will need help from him so be ready to go to office hours in order to do the homework correctly.  Tests aren't that difficult and the problems are straight from the lab manual.  With that said, you do actually need to study at least a little.

Great lecturer.  If he sees you around campus after a test, he'll say, "Hi, So-and-So; good job on the test."  His memory is amazing.  It makes you want to well because you know that he knows who you are.  If you do the homework and pay attention during class, you should do well in both MSE 350 and ME 306.

Guy is cool, really sarcastic. I think he is also attracted to students. Anyways, nice guy, but you really need to hit up office hours if you want to understand. Other than that, you don't learn, only apply "rules" to get through the exams and homework. Always choose true is not sure!

dr j is awesome! if you goto office hours and just ask him questions you will definitely do well on homeworks.  dont be afriad of his sarcasm,hes a cool dude once you get to know him.  also, he loves true statements, on his tests, almost all the true/false are true, maybe 4 or 5 out of false!
Very organized and concise in his answers. Don't be scared to ask for help.

Dr. J was a good prof.  Don't go see him during office hours.  He will make you feel real stupid.  However, he explains things pretty well and if you study the practice exams you will do well on the exams.  Lectures are real boring at first but then it gets better.  Homework takes a long time to do.

MS&E 350 is one of the best classes I've ever taken.  All I had to do is show up for every lecture, he explains things well, and do the homework  -- Easy A.  Jay Samuel is always available and willing to help, but is quite condescending too.  Be prepared for sarcasm.
great guy, knows his stuff
if you care at all in the class, he _will_ know your name. does strait up examples for lecture and is _very_ clear in doing so. my test scores have been all over 90% with minimal studying
Drinking with Doctor Jay
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
A little condescending, but really funny and nice overall
